basics.name: Jair Wuilloud
basics.label: Data Scientist / Engineer / Researcher
basics.summary: I see myself as an entrepreneurial problem solver and a team player.

work.summary: Consulting in data science for more than 30 entities, including well established companies and some of the most ambitious startups. Some of the work is described below or in **Projects**.

I was invited by JUA.AI to build advanced weather models using deep learning. Starting from a blue sky project, within 6 months, I could identify, test, train and integrate models and data architecture components that became the core of currently the best weather model predictions on the market.

At Interscript, I developed a solution to deliver transliteration with generative models. First, diacritization models were trained in arabic and hebrew, resp. reproducing and beating existing benchmarks. Next, I have designed a new approach to transliteration allowing language experts to design the necessary complex transliteration rules. Data and models are then built and trained via a semi automatised strategy that was presented on a conference to experts.

Together with a MD as a cofounder, we have developed an app for the US market allowing practitioner to easily model patient states and diseases and retrieve statistical evidences in real time via fuzzy search throughout the US healthcare dataset. The app's focus on speed allows running medical scenarios and test hypotheses in real time.

Plex AI vision: interaction with websites via language. My main contribution was building of an iOS app, the agent, the design of a neuro inspired architecture to compress the conversational logic and to run successful demos to potential customers.
I was invited at Mediaplayers to develop their data strategy. I built a data pipeline processing within 3 hours ~1 billion of daily behavioural data points.

For faxi, I built new GPS processing and carpooling recommendation algorithms. Thanks to an app that I created, communities can now easily visualise the carpoolings and their benefits in term of money saved and CO2 emissions.

I joined the company to build new language models using advantages of sparse representations. After 3 months, I developed a working model to encode and compress text that became the semantic engine after 6 months. This model was extended and tested on several business cases. The model proved to exceed some existing benchmarks, which we have documented in a paper.

At TaxiQ we created an app based on collaborative system helping cab drivers in UK to navigate within the city by solving the problem of evaluating the latest waiting times on the taxi ranks. As a CEO, I have managed to put together a team of up to 8 people and to build a MVP (web apps) with a small budget. Along with R&D and development, I developed the business plan and was pitching to potential investors and competitions.
At DB, I worked on the validation of financial models and implementations on the C++ pricing libraries.

I was working on QCD and Supersymmetry simulations. Simulations allow to run virtual experiments and perform approximations necessary to do predictions and test the standard model. I have specialised in some technical aspects of DIrac's operator determinant evaluation.
